snippet: The plan, outlined in a 20-hour negotiating session, would provide aid worth up to about $95 billion in exchange for harsh austerity terms.
abstract: Greece seems poised to reach new bailout agreement with European creditors worth up to 86 billion euros, or $95 billion; European officials are quick to warn that deal has not yet been finalized; agreement would impose harsh austerity terms and do nothing to alleviate nation's 315 billion-euro debt burden, or $345 billion.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Niki Kitsantonis from Athens, James Kanter from Brussels, Jack Ewing from Frankfurt and Alison Smale from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The plan, outlined in a 20-hour negotiating session, would provide aid worth up to about $95 billion in exchange for harsh austerity terms.

headline.main: Tentative Greek Debt Accord Might Do Little to Revive Economy
headline.print_headline: Greece Nears Agreement on Details of New Bailout
